result.execSummary:
The defendant Shad A. Krause was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant's bonds shall be applied towards the costs and any unpaid obligations are to be paid by October 9, 2016.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 10 days of sentencing and preapproved by the victim witness coordinator.

The jail sentence shall begin no later than October 5, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.   The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shad A. Krause

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Extension to Report
Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Shad A. Krause in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to disorderly conduct-domestic.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in  Case No. 15CM142.  Court finds defendant guilty in 15CM144 disorderly conduct-domestic.  Statement by Attorney Nocco.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders 30 days county jail with huber and good time to begin no later than October 5, 2016 at 4:30 pm; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology due within 10 days and preapproved by victim witness coordinator.  Defendant has no objection to the cash bonds in 15CM142 and 15CM144 being applied towards the costs.  The balance is to be paid by October 9, 2016.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on May 26, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on May 3, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Shad A. Krause in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco appearing specially.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties. Plea of not guilty to the charge.   Court orders a $150.00 cash bond and $250.00 signature bond; booking and no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 11:00 am. - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol.
